item.title: Git's hidden simplicity
item.description:
Many programmers would admit this: our knowledge of Git tends to be pretty‚Ä¶ superficial. ‚ÄúOops, what happened? Screw that, I‚Äôll cherry pick my commits and start again on a fresh branch‚Äù.

I‚Äôve been there. I knew the basic use cases. I even thought I was pretty experienced after a hundred or so resolved merge conflicts. But the confidence or fluency somehow wasn‚Äôt coming. It was a hunch: learned scenarios, commands from Stack Overflow or ChatGPT, trivia-like knowledge without a solid base.

item.title: Turn off Cursor, turn on your mind
item.description:
Two approaches to using AI

I believe that AI can make you smarter. It can help you grow faster, especially when it comes to gaining new knowledge or developing new skills. It is the perfect learning companion and a great language tutor, and it’s ability to browse the web and surface relevant links far exceeds my own. Heck, I’ve even used it ‚Äì albeit very modestly ‚Äì to polish this draft so it’s bearable to the native speakers.
